title: Publications
text:
Poses, C., Revilla, M., Schwarz, H., Asensio, M., & Weber, W. (2021). Measurement quality of 67 common social sciences questions across countries and languages based on 28 Multitrait-Multimethod experiments implemented in the European Social Survey. Survey Research Methods., 15 (3), 235–256. https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.18148/srm/ 2021.v15i3.7816
Poses, C., & Revilla, M. (2021). Measuring satisfaction with democracy: How good are different scales across countries and languages? European Political Science Review, 1–18. https://doi.org/10.1017/S1755773921000266
Revilla, M., Poses, C., Serra, O., Asensio, M., Schwarz, H., & Weber, W. (2021). Applying the Estimation Using Pooled Data Approach to the Multitrait-Multimethod Experiments of the European Social Survey (Rounds 1 to 7). Structural Equation Modeling: A Multidisciplinary Journal, 28 (3), 463–474. https://doi.org/10.1080/ 10705511.2020.1807988

title: Carlos Poses
text:
I am a PhD candidate at the Real World Evidence Team at the Utrecht University Medical Center.
My thesis focuses on the development of causal inference methods for assessing the effectiveness and safety of health interventions using health electronic records.
My supervisors are Oisín Ryan and Linda Nab, and my promotor is Miriam Sturkenboom.

title: Carlos Poses
text:
About
I graduated from the Methodology and Statistics Research Master’s at Utrecht University. During my studies, I worked both as research assistant (for the ODISSEI Social Data Science Team and the densityratio R package) and as teaching assistant for different courses. In my Master’s thesis, I developed a Bayesian implementation of the synthetic control method, a causal inference method common in the econometrics literature.
Before, I worked for three years as a researcher in survey methodology at RECSM-UPF. My main focus was measurement: estimating measurement error and assessing measurement comparability, in collaboration with the European Social Survey. Check out my publications and CV for details.
I have a background in social sciences, with a Bachelor’s degree in Philosophy, Politics and Economics from Universitat Pompeu Fabra, Universidad Autónoma de Madrid and Universidad Carlos III de Madrid.
I am originally from Galicia, and currently based in Utrecht.
